newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: EA-Generali sees unch 17 ats div in '96.
newsitem.headline: EA-Generali sees unch 17 ats div in '96.

text.p: Insurer EA-Generali said on Tuesday it expected to pay an unchanged 17 schillings dividend for 1996 and forecast group premium income would reach a record 42 billion schillings.
Last year EA-Generali, majority owned by Italy's Assicurazione Generali SpA Trieste, reported gross premium income of 36.9 billion schillings and a group net profit of 479.6 million schillings.
In a statement, EA-Generali said premium income in the first six months of this year rose 28.3 percent to 25.7 billion schillings, helped by booming life insurance.
"Group life insurance business more than doubled and topped 10 billion schillings for the first time," EA-Generali said.
Damage and accident insurance contributed 13.8 billion schillings in premium income, up 2.5 percent on last year despite tough competition in Austria, Germany, Hungary and the Czech Republic.
Health insurance accounted for 1.1 billion schillings, up 0.2 percent.
